newsitem.title: JAPAN: Nissan Fire forms Lloyd's corporate syndicate.
newsitem.headline: Nissan Fire forms Lloyd's corporate syndicate.

text.p: Nissan Fire & Marine Insurance Co Ltd said on Wednesday one of its British subsidiaries had obtained permission from Lloyd's to form a corporate syndicate that will be able to set insurance terms on its own.
Nissan Lloyd's Underwriting Ltd, a wholly owned subsidiary of Nissan Fire, has been a Lloyd's corporate member since January 1995, underwriting risks through other syndicates.
By forming its own syndicate, the company will be able to become directly involved in insurance operations, such as selecting cases and setting rates.
"The know-how acquired from our operations at Lloyd's will help us to conduct business in the increasingly deregulated insurance sector at home," said a Nissan Fire & Marine official.
In conjunction with the move, the company also boosted the British subsidiary's capital by 10 million pounds to 13.2 million pounds, the official said.
